result.markdown: --- title: "🌹 Spread the 💜 for R 📦 with valentine::roses()" description: "valentine is a small R packages that uses ChatGPT via the openai package to generate roses are red ... poetry about R packages. " author: - name: Romain François affiliation: tada⬢science affiliation-url: https://tada.science date: 2024-02-14 categories: [package, valentine, poetry, ai, love] image: logo.png citation: url: https://tada.science/posts/2024-02-14-roses-are-red draft: false --- To get ready, *at least in the R world* 😝, for Valentine's day, I've cooked a little R 📦 to spread the love by generating *Roses are Red, ...* poems about packages using ChatGPT though the [openai](https://irudnyts.github.io/openai/) package. You can install it with `pak::pak("tadascience/valentine")` and perhaps it will be released in time for Valentine's day. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} valentine::roses("tidyverse") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 🌹 Roses are red, 📊 ✨ Tidyverse is my fave, 🌈 🔧 With dplyr and ggplot2, 💻 📦 Data wrangling made easy, hooray! 🎉 ``` ::: ::: You can tweak the prompt that is sent with the `hint=` argument. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} valentine::roses("lubridate", hint = "make it kinky") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Roses are red 🌹 Lubridate helps the time thread ⏰ Handle dates with seductive grace 😏 Emojis making data kinky fun-filled chase 😉 ``` ::: :::
